rationale: There is no corresponding field in the target schema for the 'version' field from the source schema.
Both the source and target fields have the same name ('channel_id') and similar descriptions indicating the structure depends on assay type. This is an exact match.

The source field 'antibody_name' refers to the name of the antibody, while the target field 'hgnc_symbol' refers to a gene symbol. These are related concepts, as antibodies target specific proteins encoded by genes, but they are not identical. This is a close match.
Both fields refer to the RRID (a unique identifier for antibodies from the Antibody Registry). Since they share the same meaning, this is an exact match.
Both fields refer to the unique identifier for proteins in the UniProt database, so this is an exact match.
Both fields describe the vendor-specific lot number for the antibody. This is an exact match.

The source field 'dilution' uses a ratio format (e.g., 1/200), while the target field 'dilution_factor' is a whole number (e.g., 200). They represent the same concept but are expressed differently, so this is a close match.
Both fields refer to the catalog number of conjugated antibodies. This is an exact match.
Both fields refer to the entity conjugated to the antibody. This is an exact match.
